name: BGP
description: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) is the routing protocol of the Internet, used to exchange routing information between autonomous systems (AS). BGP is a path vector protocol.
key_topics: BGP attributes: AS_PATH, NEXT_HOP, LOCAL_PREF, MED
BGP states: Idle, Connect, Active, OpenSent, OpenConfirm, Established
common_misconceptions: Many training resources claim BGP is only for ISPs. Cisco documentation clarifies large enterprises use BGP for multi-homing and when connecting multiple AS numbers

Third-party materials often oversimplify BGP path selection. Cisco config guides detail the multi-step algorithm: Weight, LOCAL_PREF, locally originated, AS_PATH length, ORIGIN, MED, eBGP over iBGP, etc.
Training books frequently confuse eBGP and iBGP TTL requirements. eBGP uses TTL=1 by default (directly connected), iBGP requires manual configuration for multi-hop
Common error: forgetting that iBGP peers do NOT advertise routes learned from one iBGP peer to another iBGP peer. This requires full mesh, route reflectors, or confederation
